Golf's world No. 1 Rory McIlroy says it's the 'right call' to push September's Ryder Cup to 2021 ... but recently relaxed restrictions in the United States have allowed for the return of the sport, so long as social distancing guidelines are adhered to. President Donald Trump was among the first public figures to hit the links upon its reopening, wasting little time in dusting off his driver. McIlroy, for his part, played in a charity skins game with Americans Dustin Johnson, Rickie Fowler and Matthew Wolff to raise money for coronavirus relief charities, while a team of Tom Brady and Phil Mickelson against Peyton Manning and Tiger Woods last weekend drew several million television viewers.
